Articles.Content:
If you are going to pin mods to this forum, how about pinning useful ones.

Maybe mods that have been downloaded the most.

The most popular mods.

Mods that people actually care about.

Instead of twee little mods that does little other than to show off a modder's skills.

Just my opinion...

35 minutes ago, Daveroski said:

If you are going to pin mods to this forum, how about pinning useful ones.

Maybe mods that have been downloaded the most.

The most popular mods.

Mods that people actually care about.

Instead of twee little mods that does little other than to show off a modder's skills.

Just my opinion...

I will assume you are not referring to CKAN or Claw's Stock Bugfix modules.

The other is a Thread of the Month, all of which get pinned for the duration

That's sort of what the official mod hosting Curse site (or even Spacedock) is for: it shows the popular mods, the mods people care about. Otherwise, they like to select a grab bag of mods, some for funsies, others for serious. Otherwise, the whole first page would read: KER, MJ, MM, Trajectories, Transfer Window Planner, KAC, dependency#1, dependency#2, dependency#3, etc etc. Solid mods, but *yawn* they don't shoot elephants out into space or, as you point out, highlight a modder's skill. Which is important. Same with Modding Monday.

Although why Module Manager isn't stickied is beyond me.

12 hours ago, Deimos Rast said:

 but *yawn* they don't shoot elephants out into space or, as you point out, highlight a modder's skill. Which is important. Same with Modding Monday.

Although why Module Manager isn't stickied is beyond me.

The yawn of a seasoned vet.

A new user may feel quite differently.

I am very patient.

Smart people are always patient or they aren't being smart.

I am aware that some are not as patient as I.

A new user; new to the game; new to the forums, would look at this page first for his mods.

He wants to know what the most popular mods are and the reasons why they are so popular.

This forum is here to help new users and for vets to chin-wag and show how high they can wee.

New users are of course much more important. One doesn't have to be particularly smart to know that the more new users we have, the longer the game will go on for the rest of us.

We vets are how the game gets improved.

New Users are why the game gets improved.

We veterans already know where to find information.

This first page should and must be for new users to find the information they are looking for.

Many are not as patient as the rest of us and so should be encouraged at every quarter to have as good an experience as possible.

Perhaps a sub-forum specifically designed for modders to show off their prowess would be the way to go. Those patient among us would certainly be able to find such a sub-forum and I am sure would coo and fawn appropriately.
